item.title: Katerina add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Katerina add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "Imperfection is beauty, madness is genius and it's better to be absolutely ridiculous than absolutely boring." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Katerina add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "A wise girl kisses but doesn't love, listens but doesn't believe, and leaves before she is left." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Katerina add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "I don't mind living in a man's world, as long as I can be a woman in it." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Katerina add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "I don't know who invented high heels, but all women owe him a lot!" -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Katerina add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "If I play a stupid girl and ask a stupid question, I've got to follow it through, what am I supposed to do, look intelligent?" -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Katerina add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "The only way you can write the truth is to assume that what you set down will never be read. Not by any other person, and not even by yourself at some later date. Otherwise you begin excusing yourself. You must see the writing as emerging like a long scroll of ink from the index finger of your right hand; you must see your left hand erasing it." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Katerina add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Women have curious ways of hurting someone else. They hurt themselves instead; or else they do it so the guy doesn't even know he's been hurt until much later. Then he finds out. Then his dick falls off." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Katerina add a quote by Harold Bloom
item.description: "Reading well is one of the great pleasures that solitude can afford you." -- Harold Bloom

item.title: Katerina add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Women made civilisation impossible with all their “charm ” all their silliness." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Katerina add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "What's your name,' Coraline asked the cat. 'Look, I'm Coraline. Okay?' 'Cats don't have names,' it said. 'No?' said Coraline. 'No,' said the cat. 'Now you people have names. That's because you don't know who you are. We know who we are, so we don't need names." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Katerina add a quote by Stephenie Meyer
item.description: "He's like a drug for you, Bella." -- Stephenie Meyer

item.title: Katerina add a quote by Truman Capote
Katerina add a quote by Sophie Kinsella
item.description: "I love new clothes. If everyone could just wear new clothes everyday, I reckon depression wouldn’t exist anymore." -- Sophie Kinsella

item.title: Katerina add a quote by Sophie Kinsella
item.description: "It's a GIRL. It's a little girl, with scrunched-up petal lips and a tuft of dark hair and hands in tiny fits, up by her ears. All that time, that's who was in there. And it's weird, but the minute I saw her I just thought: IT'S YOU. Of course it is." -- Sophie Kinsella

item.title: Katerina add a quote by Sophie Kinsella
item.description:
"It really is the year 2007. Which means I must be...
Oh my God. I'm twenty-eight.
I'm old." -- Sophie Kinsella

item.title: Katerina add a quote by Audrey Niffenegger
item.description: "It’s dark now and I am very tired. I love you, always. Time is nothing." -- Audrey Niffenegger

item.title: Katerina add a quote by Hans Christian Andersen
item.description: "Every man's life is a fairy tale, written by God's fingers." -- Hans Christian Andersen

item.title: Katerina add a quote by George Meredith
item.description: "A witty woman is a treasure; a witty beauty is a power." -- George Meredith

item.title: Katerina add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Today you are You, that is truer than true. There is no one alive who is Youer than You." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Katerina add a quote by Alfred Lord Tennyson
item.description: "If I had a flower for every time I thought of you...I could walk through my garden forever." -- Alfred Lord Tennyson

item.title: Katerina add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Katerina add a quote by Margaret Atwood
Katerina add a quote by Mary Ann Shaffer
item.description: "Reading good books ruins you for enjoying bad books." -- Mary Ann Shaffer

item.title: Katerina add a quote by Mary Ann Shaffer
item.description: "That's what I love about reading: one tiny thing will interest you in a book, and that tiny thing will lead you to another book, and another bit there will lead you onto a third book. It's geometrically progressive - all with no end in sight, and for no other reason than sheer enjoyment." -- Mary Ann Shaffer

item.title: Katerina add a quote by Mary Ann Shaffer
item.description: "I don't want to be married just to be married. I can't think of anything lonelier than spending the rest of my life with someone I can't talk to, or worse, someone I can't be silent with." -- Mary Ann Shaffer

item.title: Katerina add a quote by Jane Buckingham
item.description: "I hadn’t showered for days, Jack hadn’t stopped crying in as many, and I was wondering what the return policy was on an infant." -- Jane Buckingham

item.title: Katerina add a quote by H.L. Mencken
item.description: "The older I grow, the more I distrust the familiar doctrine that age brings wisdom." -- H.L. Mencken

item.title: Katerina add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "He thought her beautiful, believed her impeccably wise; dreamed of her, wrote poems to her, which, ignoring the subject, she corrected in red ink." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Katerina add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "I'm selfish, impatient and a little insecure. I make mistakes, I am out of control and at times hard to handle. But if you can't handle me at my worst, then you sure as hell don't deserve me at my best." -- Marilyn Monroe
